DataElement.preferredName: Breast Pathology Specimen Malignant Nucleus Stain Intensity Total Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numeric value reporting the highest magnitude of strength for dye used to make the nucleus visible in cancer cells from tissue samples collected from mammary organs for examination by microscope.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Pathology Specimen Malignant Nucleus Stain Intensity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the magnitude of strength for the dye used to make the nucleus visible in cancer cells from a sample of tissue collected from the mammary organs for examination by microscope.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A specialty concerned with the nature and cause of disease as expressed by changes in cellular or tissue structure and function caused by the disease process. (MSH98):Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body.:Within a eukaryotic cell, a membrane-limited body which contains chromosomes and one or more nucleoli (CELL NUCLEOLUS). The nuclear membrane consists of a double unit-type membrane which is perforated by a number of pores; the outermost membrane is continuous with the ENDOPLASMIC RETICULUM. A cell may contain more than one nucleus. (From Singleton & Sainsbury, Dictionary of Microbiology and Molecular Biology, 2d ed):A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.:The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

Concepts.definition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.
A body within the cell, surrounded by a membrane, within which lie the chromosomes, one or more nucleoli, combined with proteins, and exhibits mitosis.
A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.
The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: updated for ISO compliance and consistent use of EVS terminology

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pathology Specimen Malignant Nucleus Stain Intensity Total Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric value reporting the highest magnitude of strength for dye used to make the nucleus visible in cancer cells from tissue samples collected from the body for examination by microscope.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: 1-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Note: report score value using CDE #64775 and this CDE as Total Score for "x of y" scaled data (e.g., Allred score)

ReferenceDocuments.name: 2-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description: See also CDE #64774 for worded/scale descriptions for reporting intensity (e.g., Allred score)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Intensity of Stained Malignan
ReferenceDocuments.description: Intensity of Stained Malignant Nuclei Scaled

DataElement.changeDescription: new CDE add to fit pattern of data on template originally created by committee
